City Council
============

The City Council is Bellinghamâ€™s legislative body, responsible for setting public policies, adopting long-range plans, approving the budget and taxes, and passing laws. Voters who live in Bellingham elect City Council Members. They serve four-year terms, except for the At-Large Council Member, who serves a two-year term.

Subscribe to City Council news](https://cob.org/gov/council/subscribe-to-city-council-news)

City Council staff members
--------------------------

All correspondence sent to City employees is subject to public disclosure requirements under
state law
. Correspondence from members of the public will be disclosed to any person who
makes a request
, unless exempt from disclosure under state law.
By
state law
, public equipment, facilities, and employee work time may not be used to support or oppose candidates or ballot propositions. Please do not send campaign-related correspondence to City offices or employees.
